segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho kassapo devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho kassapo devaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then, late at night, the glorious god Kassapa, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “bhikkhuṃ bhagavā pakāsesi, no ca bhikkhuno anusāsan”ti.
segments.en: “The Buddha has revealed the mendicant, but not his instructions to a mendicant.”
“Well then, Kassapa, clarify this matter yourself.”
“They should train in following good advice,
in sitting alone in hidden places,
That’s what the god Kassapa said,

segments.pli: Atha kho kassapo devaputto “samanuñño me satthā”ti bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Kassapa, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

suttaplex.blurb: A deity named Kassapa comes to the Buddha and speaks of the training of a mendicant in seclusion and right speech.
